summary: This is a court order by Judge Alison J. Nathan granting a short continuance of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial from July 2021 to fall 2021. The continuance is granted due to the government's late filing of an S2 Superseding Indictment, which added new charges and an alleged victim, requiring significant additional defense preparation. The order balances the defense's need for time against the interests of the defendant, victims, and the public in a timely trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose defense counsel requested a continuance of the trial date due to a new superseding indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued the order granting a short continuance of the trial until fall 2021.

persons.name: Judge Furman
persons.context: A judge presiding over a separate criminal matter involving lawyers who also represent Maxwell; his adjournment of a trial date is noted as affecting scheduling conflicts.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell and ruled on her motion for a continuance.

events.title: Filing of S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: The Government filed a superseding indictment adding new charges, extending the timeframe of alleged conspiracies to 2004, and identifying a fourth alleged victim (Minor Victim-4).

events.title: Original Trial Start Date
events.description: The trial was originally scheduled to commence on this date before being adjourned.

events.title: Court Order Granting Continuance
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order granting Maxwell's request for a short continuance, moving the trial start date to fall 2021.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Trial Date Proposal
events.description: The parties are ordered to meet, confer, and jointly propose a new trial start date to the court.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The S2 Superseding Indictment extended the timeframe of the alleged conspiracies from through 1997 to 2004 and identified a fourth alleged victim, referred to as Minor Victim-4.
The S2 Indictment added two new charges: Count 5 (sex trafficking conspiracy 2001-2004) and Count 6 (sex trafficking of a minor or aiding and abetting).
The court granted a continuance until fall 2021, rejecting both Maxwell's alternative request for January 2022 and the Government's proposal for March 2022.
The continuance was granted due to the significant new burden on the defense from the S2 indictment and ongoing complications from the COVID-19 pandemic on trial preparation.
The order emphasizes the need to balance the defense's preparation time against the defendant's pretrial detention and the public/victims' interest in a timely trial.
